title: Business News: Corporate Watch
text:
Information on Deal

Tractor Supply Co. on Friday said it received a request for additional information and documentary materials from the Federal Trade Commission concerning its planned acquisition of farm and ranch retailer Orscheln Farm & Home.

Orscheln received a similar request, Tractor Supply said.

The company also said Tractor Supply and Orscheln Farm & Home "continue to cooperate fully with the FTC in its review of the pending acquisition."

In February, Tractor Supply said it agreed to acquire Orscheln Farm & Home in an all-cash transaction valued at about $297 million. Orscheln operates 167 stores in 11 states.

-- Stephen Nakrosis

---

VALNEVA

Vaccine Firm Files

For Nasdaq Debut

Vaccine company Valneva SE filed for an initial public offering with the Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday.

Valneva said it intends to apply to list its American depository shares on the Nasdaq Global Market under the symbol "VALN." Its stock is currently listed on Euronext Paris under the symbol "VLA."

The company said its lead program, VLA15, "is a Phase 2 vaccine candidate targeting Borrelia, the bacterium that causes Lyme disease, under development in collaboration with Pfizer." The company also said "it is the only active vaccine candidate against Lyme disease currently undergoing clinical trials."

For the year ended Dec. 31, 2020, Valneva said it had a loss per share of 0.71 euros, the equivalent of 84 cents, on revenue of 110.3 million euros. For the year earlier, the company had a loss per share of 0.02 euros on revenue of 126.1 million euros. Groupe Grimaud La Corbiere SAS, Fonds MVM and Bpifrance Participations SA are listed among its principal shareholders. Valneva didn't give an expected size for its IPO, nor did it indicate an expected price range.

-- Stephen Nakrosis

---

J.M. SMUCKER

Two Lots of Meow

Mix Are Recalled

J.M. Smucker Co. said it is voluntarily recalling two lots of Meow Mix Original Choice Dry Cat Food due to the potential presence of salmonella.

The company said it received no reports of pet illness or adverse reaction.

Smucker said the recalled 30-pound bags were sold at certain Walmart Inc. stores in Illinois, Missouri, Nebraska, New Mexico, Oklahoma, Utah, Wisconsin and Wyoming. The items have the UPC code 2927452099, with lot numbers 1081804 and 1082804 and Best If Used By dates of 9/14/2022 and 9/15/2022.

-- Josh Beckerman

---

FACEBOOK

Product Chief Pay

Valued at $69.7 Million

Facebook Inc. Chief Product Officer Chris Cox, who rejoined the company in June, had 2020 compensation valued at $69.7 million, the company said in its proxy filing.

Most of the total is for restricted stock units with an initial equity value of $60 million, with vesting scheduled to take place in installments through August 2024, subject to continued employment. The filing lists $421,385 for base salary and bonus amounts of $691,334.

Mr. Cox is entitled to receive a $4 million sign-on bonus to be paid after the first anniversary of rejoining the company, subject to continued service. Mr. Cox left the company in 2019 after disagreements with Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg.

Facebook also said Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg's total compensation value was $24.8 million, with the majority of that reflecting stock awards. The $25.3 million figure for Mr. Zuckerberg includes security and aircraft expenses. As in previous years, his base salary was $1.

-- Josh Beckerman
